could.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
could.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: By the time she was eight, she could read Greek and Latin.
In those days you could buy a box of cigars for a dollar.
Could you hear what I was saying?
I couldn’t get tickets after all, they were sold out.
I knew I couldn’t afford the rent.
The teacher said we could all go home.
could.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used to say that something is possible or might happen
could.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Most accidents in the home could be prevented.
It could be weeks before we get a reply.
If you’re not careful, you could get into even worse trouble.
A faulty connection could easily  (=would be likely to) cause a fire.
could.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used to say that something was a possibility in the past, but did not actually happen
could.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I could have warned you if I had known where you were.
He could have escaped, but he chose to fight.
could.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used to emphasize how happy, angry etc you are by saying how you want to express your feelings
could.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: He irritates me so much I could scream.
I was so angry I could have killed her.
I was so relieved I could have kissed them all.
could.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: used to make a polite request
could.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Could you help me with these boxes?
Could I have a drink of water, please?
How about Sam? Could he come along too?
I wonder if I could just ask you to sign this.
could.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: You could ask your doctor for a check-up.
You could always try phoning her at the office.
Maybe we could get together sometime next week?
Couldn’t you get one of your friends to help you?
could.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: used to show that you are annoyed about someone’s behaviour
could.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: You could have told me you were going to be late  (=you should have told me but you did not)!
You could at least say that you’re sorry.
How could you be so stupid!
could.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with could
could.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: You use could  with the base form of the verb  (=the infinitive without ‘to’)
The teacher said we could go home
He could be in his office
could.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: You say Could I?  when asking for permission
could.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: You say that something could have happened
They could already have gone home
could.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3: You use couldn’t or could not in negative sentences
